intro: Ascocentropsis malipoensis, commonly known as the Malipo starling tree, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody structure. The plant is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are often white or pale in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
